name: Las Torres Patagonia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel last minute as there was a fire in the park and our original hotel was in the part of the park that was closed.
reviews.title: Expensive but very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very nice, it is well built and good in all regards.
reviews.title: Lovely modern place in the middle of pristine nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: My advice would be to book half board only and pay the activities as you do them: the all-in package seems a rip off.
reviews.title: Spectacular!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the reception could be better, but it is not a big deal: they respond to you eventually...
reviews.title: Stunning location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only disappointing thing is the dinner which is a buffet that cost $50: a normal restaurant a la carte would be much better. We even tried the dinner at the Refugio Torres nearby, but it is not worthy even there; $18 for a very poor dinner (it is not like the shelters on the Alps!). Though the refugio looks very nice.
reviews.title: Only good things to say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I spent 5 days at Las Torres in February 2012. I have read the other reviews and I think this hotel/experience is really better than some are giving it credit for. This hotel is in a very remote area. It is expensive to get food and supplies, so naturally the cost of the hotel is going to be expensive. Many equate that price to mean it should be a luxury experience, but really, in Patagonia, paying a lot of money gets you a solid experience because of the costs of the basics. If you are going to Torres del Paine, it should be for the surroundings and not to hang out in your hotel all day.
reviews.title: Fantastic locations and excursions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The excursions are the best part of this hotel. We were able to get every excursion we wanted by making some requests. And every day, my friend and I ended up being the only people on the hike, but they sent us out with a guide anyway and didn't try to force us into another group. The guides are really fabulous and know a lot about the flora/fauna/geology of the area and are just generally fun and patient. The location of the hotel is unbeatable with easy access to the W trail. There is really no hotel/lodge better situated in the park except for the campsites.
reviews.title: No customer service at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was pretty basic, but it was clean, we had towels and hot water, and really only used it for sleeping. The front desk staff all spoke English and were helpful. I never really waited more than a few minutes for help. It is true that only 1 person can set up the wireless access on your computer, so sometimes you have to wait, but again, for me, that wasn't a big deal because I was there to hike and not use my computer for the most part. If you are really desperate, you can sue the computer in the lobby. Just like many things in South America, things happen at a different pace and we fast-paced US folks need to embrace that. I was on vacation, so really a small wait at the front desk was no big deal.
reviews.title: Great location, average rooms and yes, bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was adequate. Boxed lunches provided for hikes were great. Dinner provided a lot of variety. The food was solidly good but not outstanding, with the exception of desserts, which were excellent. However, I found them to be very accommodating of some special dietary needs and they often made special items up at dinner for me. The wines provided in the all-inclusive package are really quite good. Cocktails in the bar were also great after a long day's hike.
reviews.title: Think of this as a trekking centre, then you will be pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only small complaint I have is that the reservation process was a little time consuming and I needed to send many emails and call a few times before I had a room confirmed. I heard the same from some other guests. I think they try to get you into a higher priced room, but stay persistent and it will work out.
reviews.title: Stunning location, excellent excursions, shame about the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a lovely vacation spoiled because the staff helped themselves to some of our clothing & jewelry which was taken from the luggage in our rooms.
reviews.title: perfect vacation ruined by thieving staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manager was not available to help resolve the problem immediately and the very young staff clearly had no clue how to handle the situation.
reviews.title: Good hotel, beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There was/is NO security at the hotel so if you go, don't take any thing of value and by all means leave NOTHING in your room.
reviews.title: Luxury Oasis in Torres Del Paine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in TOTAL denial about their problem and they refused to try and address it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A perfect vacation RUINED!!!
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as it had the highest ratings for the area. I must admit, the hotel was beautifully located, right at the bottom of the Torres. We upgraded to have a room with a view - and that we really did. Every morning we woke up to the stunning view of mountains taking up the entire (big window). The rooms were big and very, very clean.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel... but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However... the food and drinks were extremely expensive. And the problem was that you had no choice but to eat there because there are no other restaurants within walking distance. The dinner buffet is 44$US and the food is extremely mediocre. The cheapest bottle of wine is 20$US which for Chile, is quite expensive. We ate dinner most nights at the "bar' - and though they only had sandwiches and salads - they were actually quite delicious, and at 15$ a sandwich, it's definitely a more reasonable option.
reviews.title: REASONABLE MODERN HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In terms of the day trips - we only took the "full paine" daytrip which cost 200$/per person but was well worth it. We were driven around the entire park, stopped at scenic look outs, had a delicious lunch packed for us and went on the amazing Grey Glacier boat trip. We calculated out the cost of doing a similar trip on our own, and it would have cost nearly the same, and we wouldn't have seen anywhere near to as many vistas as we did. In terms of the 100$ hiking trips, unless you are a very intrepid hiker, there is no need to sign up for these expensive hiking trips. There are plenty of people on all the trails, so there's no way you could get lost. If you are worried about food - ask the hotel to pack you a lunch (for 20$, of course) - and you are set!
reviews.title: So disappointing ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly, highly recommend the park as a destination. The hotel was fine, though we did feel quite poor and taken advantage of by the end of our 3 nights there.Unfortunately though, unless you want to camp or stay in refugios, I'm not sure there is a much better option!
reviews.title: absolute delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very small standard room. Restaurant overpriced for extremely mediocre food, alternative
reviews.title: Excellent location with good food and guides

aka: Las Torres Patagonia Hotel Torres Del Paine
description: Hotel Las Torres is located in the heart of the National Park at the foot of the main tourist attraction, Las Torres del Paine and the starting point of the main trails of the park.With 84 room we offer All Inclusive Packages as well as bed & breakfast options.In any case, we are very flexible, with no fixed dates or days of arrival.We do have daily tour options to the main attractions of the park, as well as a nice restaurant with local cuisine options.
